name: Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location right next to Tiergarten. Our roomon the eight floor had a lovely view over the park. The room was very nice, clean and modern. the staff was very helpful. The breakfast buffet was faboulus, one of the best hotel breakfasts I've had.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel, very good service and very nice pool and spa area. You can actually swim in the pool;-) Some of the higher - and more expensive - rooms have view over the Berlin Zoo. We had a very good winter-deal (around 110 euro pr. night for the cheapest doubleroom) and this was very good value.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in October. The Hotel is located in the shopping area of Berlin and across from the Intercontinental. The public spaces are large and rather cold in design. Front desk staff are well trained and polite.
reviews.title: Average Business Hotel

reviews.text: My room was an average 4 star box with a comfortable bed (never can quite understand in some places in Europe why two twins are pushed together rather than just having a Queen though). My main complaint, and it is a key one for me, is there are no irons or boards in the room. When I ordered one the front desk said they were all out. Iwas directed a room onthe floor where I waited for my fellow travellors to finish.
reviews.title: Mixed Experience of Good, Bad & Ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry but for a four star in this day and age you need to have these in every room. For me this is a box I need ticked along with good wifi, and a good selection of pwer outlets preferably near the bed. Two out of three isn't good enough. Due to this I can't recommend the hotel to fellow business travellers.
reviews.title: Great value in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Following our stay in Hamburg and because it was my birthday, my husband and myself spent 4 nights in the Pullman Berlin hotel. The check in was really fast and the lady at the reception desk did her job correctly (without a smile). Nevertheless, we arrived to our room (number 701) which was big enough and we were welcomed with a bottle of red wine, some sweets made at the kitchen of the hotel and a mix of almonds with some dry strawberries. It was a really nice surprise for celebrating my birthday.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, big and we had coffee and tea facilities. It was surprising that the choice of TV channels was limited for a foreigner. They had weird channels like TV Galicia instead of TVE.
reviews.title: Perfect city centre hotel

reviews.text: A big disappointment was the wifi service which was under payment (aprox 9 eur). It is surprising that in our days people have to pay to use internet. Most of hotels all over the world do not charge for such a basic service.
reviews.title: A hotel for animal, watersport and shopping enthusiasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good but nothing special. I have been in other Pullman hotels were breakfast was much better and with a bigger selection of products.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: In the other hand, there was an evening service where they would come to your room to open your bed and leave a chocolate. And, at the same time, they were always having details with Clients: a chocolate San Nicolas on 6th December, coockies and hot wine at reception area,etc.
reviews.title: Simply Excellent - Business - 4 nights

reviews.text: First time in Berlin and always with a sense of trepidation.
reviews.title: Truly excellent hotel!

reviews.text: The Pullman Berlin is a exceptionally well run and delightful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff.It is very well placed opposite the tiergarten and is easily reached from Berlin tegel airport by the x9
reviews.title: Nice business hotel

reviews.text: Bus that terminates about 5 minutes walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding service - great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought one day travel tickets from the hotel that cover Berlin bus and train services for €6,50 per day per person.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small but beautifully lit and furnished.
reviews.title: Christmas visit to Berlin.

reviews.text: Contemporary design, quiet rooms, very well maintained and clean. Outgoing, friendlyand knowledgeable staff.One of the best breakfast buffets I have had. Large Spa with large indoor pool, sauna and treatments
reviews.title: Outstanding yet quiet downtown location

reviews.text: Nice hotel, well placed near Tiergarten and not far from KDW. Comfortable beds, air-conditioned rooms where you could open the windows. Large rooms with water cattle. Work lounge with computers, printer and free WIFI. Nice pool and sauna area. The breakfast was the top! Very good and nice and a big choice of fresh products, 10 sorts of bread etc.
reviews.title: Berlin october 2012

reviews.text: I stayed at the Pullman unexpectedly, having been bumped out of the Intercontinental over the road due to over-booking. I think it was probably an upgrade because the hotel was very nice. Staff were very friendly, with excellent English. My room was spacious and well appointed, including the bathroom. TV has a few English channels, inc BBC, ITV, Channel 4. The restaurant was great, the rump steak cooked to perfection, the chicken delightful. House wines, both red and white, were fab. There's a huge swimming pool at basement level, with a spa and space for lounging in your dressing gown or swimsuit... do take your own costume, the one I enquired about buying was €70! I was travelling on business so didn't see the sights, but for those who are, this hotel is 100m from the Zoo Aquarium. My only negative is that the room service Continental breakfast was coffee, juice and various breads... I'd have liked some cereal!
reviews.title: Spacious, welcoming, great restaurant

reviews.text: Stayed at the Pullman in Berlin for 3 nights whilst travelling on my own. Great location in a pretty street - 10mins from shops and train station for tours and opposite the picturesque zoo.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Food and staff excellent. As I am a keen swimmer, the swimming pool was great to lap swim in after a long day out. Would loved to have stayed longer. I had the deluxe room with late check out at 3pm which also included breakfast. Great value.
reviews.title: The best hotel we have ever stayed in

description: The Sofitel Berlin Schweizerhof welcomes you in the centre of the metropolis. Experience the special ambiance of our prestigious hotel with 383 elegant rooms and 18 modern function rooms. Relax in our exclusive Aqua Spa, the biggest indoor hotel pool in Berlin, or enjoy regional and Mediterranean treats. Tourists and business guests both appreciate the location close to the Kurfurstendamm, 3 to 5 km from the central railway station and the exhibition centre.
